stepTitle:
Consider the two allotropes of oxygen: O₂ (molecular oxygen) and ozone (O₃). Given the following standard entropies and enthalpies of formation, use the Gibbs free energy formula to determine which form of oxygen is thermodynamically stable at $$298$$ K:

O₂: ΔH°_f $$=$$ $$0$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, S° $$=$$ $$205.14$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$
O₃: ΔH°_f $$=$$ $$142.67$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, S° $$=$$ $$238.92$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$

Calculate ΔG° for the conversion of ozone to molecular oxygen, and determine which allotrope is more stable at the given temperature.
